title: Album leaf
text: Ethiopian Christian art developed its own style once the new faith became the state religion in the 350s. This painting on parchment belongs to a larger ensemble of 44 leaves featuring Ethiopian saints and scenes from the Hebrew Scriptures and New Testament. Here we see the Ascension—Christ ascending to heaven with the apostles below and angels above—with figures identified in Ge’ez, an ancient language now used only in a liturgical context.
description: 44 individual paintings, received framed and mounted in four rows of eleven paintings, each row attached together with two string loops; oranges, flesh tone, blue, yellow, black, brown, green and grey; various religious scenes--see Components for descriptions of each leaf
creditline: The Robert J. Ulrich Works of Art Purchase Fund
